38871219.review:
If you're reading this review, I can tell you right now that Invisigun Heroes is destined to become one of the all-time great couch co-op games.

The pixel graphics & animation are excellent, the controls are tight, and the music & sound are definitely above decent. But that's not what makes Invisigun Heroes a great game.

What makes Invisigun great is the core gameplay. Until you fire (or bump into something), you're entirely invisible to everyone including yourself. This makes for some stunning emergent play choices. Most matches will see you wildly swinging between methodical, stealthy positioning, and frenetic button mashing as your ambush goes horribly awry and everything goes sideways.

Throughout all of it, you have to keep your eye on the telltale signs of enemy passage and the sound of their footsteps as they cross different terrain, trying to determine their location so you can make them stumble into your killshot and snag the victory. The strategic choices are deep enough to create a high skill ceiling, but easy enough to grasp that they will eventually become intuitive. And this is a game that rewards intuition.

The character design choices are solid as well, offering a hero for any playtype you might prefer: mobility, recon, decoys, teleports, counters, even air strikes. All heroes have foils who are appropriate counters to them, and the base invisibility mechanic manages to level the playing field and give players a fighting chance even against heroes who would seem to be more powerful in a given matchup.

Just to keep things interesting, the game air-drops power ups onto the field every 20 seconds or so (configurable), providing advantages like invisible/inaudible footsteps, shots that drop secondary bombs in adjacent tiles, reducing delay between shots, and a lot more. Not only do the powerups add to the gameplay but they create 'hot zones' on the map where you can be sure your enemy is heading, and try to intercept them.

I also just want to add that there are many small, brilliant tweaks to prevent stale gameplay. For example, if two shots meet in midair, they cancel each other out - but also leave a small explosion that lasts a second, blocking further shots, giving you a moment to move and regain your invisibility if you want to and keeping the match from devolving into a straight slugfest.

All this is not to say that the game has no flaws Some maps will heavily favor one hero over another - for example, Iris (with dash ability) will excel on maps that are wide open. And some maps are just ridiculously assembled - there's a map in the kickstarter group that contains no possible jumps, crippling Celene who relies on jumps for mobility. And of course, at the time of this writing, the game is as-yet-unknown and it can be tough to find an online quickmatch. But with further tweaking, more maps, more heroes, and more visibility, I can see these nitpicks fading into the background, much as the heroes do after zapping an opponent. And you can always hop into the Invisigun Discord and find friendly players to challenge.

All in all, Invisigun Heroes is an ecstatic co-op experience that had me howling with joy while playing it. I cannot recommend it strongly enough for players who have a taste for fast-paced, intuitive strategy and frantic couch co-op action. Considering the high level of quality, it's hard to believe the studio is a one-person name. I did receive a copy of this game for free from a friend of the creator, but I easily would have purchased it on the strength of the demo -  especially at 35% off for the Christmas sale - and have already bought several copies for friends.

Pick it up today. You won't regret it.

EDIT - I've used the words "couch co-op" a couple of times, and upon consideration, it's more appropriate to call it "couch competitive."

37760879.review:
This game is downright incredible. Its mechanics of having all the characters be invisible is incredibly clever and, when communicating with others you're playing against, is incredibly fun. Especially, those panicked moments when you're the last two standing and you run into each other. Furthermore, the game has a massive number of maps available, numerous game-modes, each class is creative and varried enough to feel interesting to play on its own...the whole thing is a fantastic experience. Not to mention, the developers have been pushing out updates quite regularly...including even a new (well... Ish. It's been out for a bit) observation mode for people that are streaming so that the game is far more exciting to watch. 

Unfortunately, the game isn't exactly widespread in terms of online play. The sad portion is that this game, despite having proper online support, befalls to the same traps as games like TowerFall Ascention or Nidhogg fall into, where if you aren't able to organize a group of people to get on and play, the chan ces of you doing much of anything aren't particularly high. I mean, there are single player challenges, but they aren't nearly exciting as the online matches (as a parallel example, think of playing Loves in a Dangerous Spacetime solo versus in co-op). 

So, while I would absolutely love to recommend the game to everyone for being fantastic (and, hopefully, to buff the number of online players), but... That is unfortunately its downfall. Not a lot of people playing means that people are going to be reluctant to grab it....which means that there aren't going to be a lot of people playing. That said, if you can organize some mates, whether in person or over the internet with VoIP, definitely check it out. It's truly incredible.

It takes a little time to check out how to play Invisigun: The difficulty is, that you can not see yourself while you move, except, when you bump into something or shoot. The same applies to your opponents. It's like a sneak and shoot game. The key to the game is to count the tiles on the ground or the steps while moving, and remember where you are. I highly advise to play with a D-Pad not the analog sticks of your controller.
After you master the movement it's a really entertaining and fast game, best played with friends on your couch in front of the tv. It has nearly the same addiction like the battle mode in the first Mario Kart on the SNES.
Really great competitive gameplay and a lot of fun!

The graphics and the sound is great and fits too. If you like such multiplayer games, get it!

Recommendations for options / features / fixes:

    1. Kill the broken automated quick-match matchmaker. Allow players to filter by ping, region, language, gametype, etc. Players select tags, throw 'em on a filter stack, client allows players to select one from a shortlist.

    3. Enable match-browser whereby players can browse active games.  
    4. Figure out a rework for match rooms to include more players, VOIP, chat, and spectate. If >4 players host selects the active players or rotation-mode, allow host to set banners, rules, passwords, etc.

    6. Add player stat-tracking system for tournament/ranked/ELO/ etc.

Shit, I'm a developer and I'd much rather work on games than business software. Pay me a decent wage and I'll program the backend.

34831739.review:
It's painfully frustrating at first, but if you've got at least one good friend to play with and has patience to learn along side you, you'll quickly find yourself having an intense amount of fun.

There's a wide array of gameplay modes which make it incredibly replayable, the visuals are sharp and create a lot of interesting visual cues to help you keep track of yourself and enemies. The various heroes are unique and feel balanced.

On the topic of heroes though, some of the mechanics feel a little off, either intentional or not, which lead to some confusing moments. It would be nice if we had a test area where you could experiment with heroes without the invisibility so you could get a feel for them before you go into a live match.

Only major issue I have with the game is the way games are set up. While I totally get and appreciate the ability to create custom maps using codes you can share on the Discord channel, I feel like the lack of proper Steam integration makes creating and entering private games with friends is harder than it should be. This is possibly the first and only online game worth playing, that doesn't have the ability to "Invite" or "Join" friends via Steam.

34819453.review:
[h1] 概要 [/h1]
このゲームを簡単に説明すると「爆弾を銃に持ち替えたボンバーマン」ですが、ある大きな特徴があります。
それは[b] プレイヤーキャラすべてが透明 [/b]ということです。

キャラの姿が画面上に現れるのはショットを撃つか、キャラそれぞれが持つスキルを使った一瞬のみであり、
それ以外では、歩数や足音、壁に当たった時の反応などで、自分や敵の位置を把握しなければいけません。

[h1] ゲームモード [/h1]
ゲームモードは2つで、BOTを相手にする1人用のチャレンジモードと、2～4人対戦のオンラインマッチがあります。
チャレンジモードは3体のBOTを相手に一度も死なずに勝つことを目指す1人用のモード。
オンラインマッチは7つのルールに60以上のマップで、フレンドから知らない人まで入り乱れて遊べます。
また、ローカルの場合は人数分のパッドさえあれば1つのソフトで4人まで遊ぶことができます。

それぞれのモードで使えるプレイヤーキャラは9人おり、それぞれ「一マス分の地形を飛び越える」「本体そっくりのデコイを動かす」など独自のスキルを持っています。
スキル以外の能力に差はないので、スキルか見た目で選びましょう。

オンラインマッチでは一戦が終わるごとに、その試合終了間際のリプレイを見ることができます。
キャラがどう動いたかが可視化される他、gifで出力できるので名シーンや迷シーンを見返すことが出来ます。

[h1] デモ版 [/h1]

Pretty amazing game. Obviously this is great party game but what surprised me is that the AI is pretty good. I saw a move from the AI last night that was so crafty, I had to watch the replay just to see how that it happened.

Replays make this game great. You can study exactly what happened and what you can do to get better. But what I really like about replays is that you can easily save them in game as animated gifs to share with friends. A simple nice touch that makes this game all the better.

The variety of characters to choose from also give this game a great added layer of depth. While this game reminds me of the old bomberman games (which were great), all the characters were the same. Here each hero has uniquely different play styles. Some more aggressive for close quarters play. Some more sneaky and subtle. It's fantastic as there's a play-style for everyone.

I cannot recommend this game enough. It's clever, unique, easy to play when you're short on time to get a few games in. One of the better games I've played in some time.

34748078.review:
With over 50 maps and 7 modes for all of them, lots of power ups and several different characters Invisigun Heroes brings a lot of variety to the table. The game's mix of invisible movement, abilities, timing and sound based guessing forces players to make fast decisions and react immediately. Every prediction shot is a gamble that pushes the risk/reward balance between killing your enemies and revealing your position, this can be quite thrilling when you have to make these calls while simultaneously having an eye on what is happening on the map and keep track of your own invisible character.
Contrary to my expectations the game is a lot of fun when played online with random people, I originally thought of it as a pure couch co-op title. If you still want to be in voice with people to have some laughs about botched shots or marvel at impressive moves, there is an active community server on discord. Finding a public game also hasn't been an issue for me and playing from Europe on other servers like US East also provides you with a stable connection. [i](Update: Apparently I had some luck in the beginning, consistently finding public games isn't so easy after all. Still I was always able to find game through discord.me/invisigun[/i]). In addition to the multiplayer modes there is an extensive single player challenge mode with 3 difficulties, that can get you through an online drought.

In short: Invisigun Heroes is a highly entertaining and fast multiplayer game you can enjoy online or with friends, it really nails its concept and gives you single player content as a bonus. Definitely worth its sale price, just grab it and have fun. 
If you miss the sale but have any interest whatsoever in the concept or have enjoyed indie multiplayer titles like Duck Game or Towerfall, you're almost certain to still get your moneys worth at full price.

33113671.review:
[h1]맵만 보이는 상태에서 벌어지는 깽판[/h1]
Q. 이 게임을 할 때 가장 긴장감을 느꼈던 때는 언제입니까? 적의 총알이 날아올 때?
A. 아뇨 서로 부딪혔을때요

인비지건 히어로즈는 너도 나도 캐릭터인식장애에 걸린 상태로 적을 찾아 없애는 게임입니다.
기본적으로 자신의 캐릭터를 포함한 적 캐릭터가 보이지 않습니다.
처음에는 이 시스템에 대해 많이 의문을 품었습니다.
' 캐릭터가 안보이면 자신이 총알에 맞아죽는지 안죽는지 모를 거 아니야? 그럼 긴장감이 있기는 한건가? '
실제로도 게임을 시작해보니, 캐릭터가 보이지 않아 긴장감이 없었습니다.
초반에는 말이에요.

그런데 적응하니까 나름 괜찮아지더라고요. 
' 어 이게 맞으려나? 맞으려나? '
라는 생각이 들어 긴장감있게 즐겼던 것 같습니다. 특히 적응할수록 자신의 캐릭터의 위치를 가늠하기 쉬워져서....

일단 서로의 캐릭터가 안보인다는 이유때문에 진입장벽이 좀 높습니다. 만약 구매하실 생각이라면 데모부터 해보시는 것이 좋다고 생각되네요.
게임에 적응하고 싶으신 분들을 위한 팁.

1. 위치가늠하기 힘들어하시는 뉴비분들은 총 자주 쏘며 다니세요.
    자신의 위치를 알리는 것은 안좋지만 자신의 위치를 모르는 것이 더 안좋습니다.
    동시에 적 캐릭터와 지형지물의 상호작용을 유심히 살펴보시고 적의 위치도 가늠하세요.
    적이 가까이 왔다 싶으시면 총 쏘는 걸 잠시 멈추시고 기회를 노리세요.

2. 캐릭터는 프로테우스를 추천합니다. 일단 특수기술(c키)이 적의 위치를 가늠하는 데 도움이 되고, 상대방의 행동에 제약을 줄 수도 있어요.

3.  초보분들은 되도록이면 수풀, 물등. 서로의 위치를 가늠하기 쉬운 오브젝트들이 많은 맵을 고르세요. 

진입장벽만 넘기면 나름대로 즐길만한 작품이라고 생각합니다.
스팀평가중 부정적 평가를 보면 [strike]짱깨들의 중국어안됨, 중국어 서버없음(한국은 있음)투정과[/strike] 멀티플레이 매칭잡기 힘들다가 주를 이루고 있습니다. 게임성자체는 크게 문제 없다고 보셔도 좋아요.

정말 중요한 참고사항 하나 말씀드리자면
데모버젼에서 온라인이 가능합니다!
이 게임 없는 친구분께 데모 설치하라고 하고 같이 멀티를 즐길 수 있습니다.
다만, 친구분은 제한이 약간 걸린다는게 흠.

장점
+참신함.
+다양하고 독특한 맵들과 기믹들
+데모로도 멀티 가능.
단점
- 매...칭...이...안...잡...혀 (인디게임이다보니 인지도의 차이가..)
- 죽은 뒤에 관전할 때 할 게 없음. 최소한 캐릭터들의 위치라도 표시해줬으면 좋겠는데...
- AI가 좀 멍청함. 그리고 서바이벌 모드이외의 AI가 전혀 만들어져 있지 않음.

평점은 7/10

33001472.review:
This innovative little gem has been polished to perfection! Packed with cleverly designed content that's as charming as it is remarkable. Every game mode, character and planet is truly unique. 

The core game play of invisible gunslingers is brilliantly entertaining. It allows you to play fast and furious, or slowly and carefully, all the while keeping an eye out for clues. You'll find yourself alternating between, stalking prey like some kind of alien or predator, and blindly firing like a panicked colonial marine. Good times!

They even offer a free demo. This allows anyone who owns the game to host their friends for free. I'm really looking forward to playing this with all my friends. And if you only fly solo, the very capable bots ensure you can still experience all the game has to offer.

Edit: We've had a lot of fun with online multiplayer, but unfortunately, we've also had a lot of trouble with it. Same screen and single player work great, so I still recommend this game.

31163276.review:
Hmm, I'm a bit torn on this one. I actually backed it on Kickstarter last year, because it's a fun idea...Bomberman meets the indie trend in  one-hit multiplayer battle games (Samurai Gunn, TowerFall, etc.), plus its own unique set of mechanics. That sounded cool, so I was glad to support the game. In execution, however, Invisigun Heroes isn't quite as polished as I would have liked. The battle arenas are a little too cluttered and claustrophobic, so you can't really "hunt" your opponents in the way that I was hoping for. The arenas are really meant for just two players, I feel, and didn't have the room to skulk around and plot your attack against three other players. The character portraits are so awesome and stylish, but the actual sprites are kind of generic and don't have much personality to them. The unique character powers are pretty good, but the basic ones are way too simple, in my opinion...everybody should really have had the ability to jump and dash. That's just a personal observation, though. What's much more significant is the fact that online multiplayer is basically dead. I can't find a public match to save my life. The search client just sits there forever, trying to track down public games that probably don't exist.

I'm still going to give this a recommended review, strangely enough. The game is certainly fun for what it is. There are some cool game modes and local multiplayer is nice in small doses. If your gaming group enjoys co-op battle games, this is worth picking up on sale. It's not as great as a lot of other games in the genre and it's not going to replace Samurai Gunn for me and my group, but that doesn't mean it's a terrible game by any means. If you've put those other, better games through their paces and you want something new, this game's invisibility mechanic and unique design decisions will be worth a few laughs. I know this isn't the most compelling recommendation in the world, but I think that sometimes it's okay to say, "this is a decent game that has some fun moments even if it isn't flawless or uniformally spectacular." I don't regret backing the game at all, but I do think it could have been a bit richer than it is.

However, do NOT get this game if A) you're looking for a single player experience, or B) you want to get in on some online multiplayer action, because there's just nothing happening on that front. You should think of this as *purely* a local co-op game.

31002020.review:
Gives me Bomberman tingles but with the modern day sensibilities and style of something like Towerfall. For me though, this trumps both due to its plethora of game modes, maps, unique and diverse characters and, ultimately, the ribbon that ties it all together: the invisibility.

In Invisigun Heroes it's about reading your foes and anticipating their position; looking and listening for subtle cues -- footsteps in the sand/snow, splashes in the water, impact thuds against walls; cooking up strategies with your hero for the mode and map you're on; snagging pickups to aid your chances of success. Sometimes it's good to just stand still and use your senses to pinpoint players and make a surgical strike, other times you'll need to just use your intuition and bulldoze in there.

It blows my mind that this was made by one guy because it's so polished with a cracking little tutorial, field guide and hero profiles, a snappy UI as well as beautiful pixel art and a fittingly pulsing arcade soundtrack (Shadi Muklashy worked on the HAWKEN soundtrack which was also great). Gah, Invisigun Heroes deserves much more love.

Add to all this that it's got online and local multiplayer as well as a LAN/private IP mode and you're looking at a dynamite package for party play. I've only played locally and it was a total blast, but I hear that the Discord channel is the place to go to arrange online games.

For £11 it's a no-brainer if you're partial to some good ol' fashioned multiplayer arcade action.

Oh, and it's not exactly a game for solo play. There's a single-player challenge mode which is good to cut your teeth on, but it's best enjoyed against real people.

Product was sent to me by the developers free of charge.

Pros:
Invisibility mechanic - Helped by environmental sound and visual ques, one of the more unique games you can
get for your money for game night.
Characters - Each has thier own special ability and taunt phrases.
Art - Incredibly colorful and detailed that lends itself to the games invisibility mechanic.
Sounds: Music is amazing and sound design is superb. Blassting your friends sound great.
Set-up - No EULA, no tutorial, get right in with an X-input or D-Input controller or share a keyboard.
Stats - Track progress with a detailed achievement and stat system for single and multiplayer modes.
Content - 5 themed planets each with 10 different maps (50 maps in total) with 7 game modes to choose from.

Neutral:
One play challenge mode (nice bonus but nothing that will hold your interest.
AI - A bit buggy during some objective-based game modes but otherwise decent enough.

Cons:
Customization - No extended options like you would have in Smash Bros. Melee or Towerfall for permanent powerups.
Online - Not a lot of people are playing and there is no proper lobby system.

Overall, it's a solid game for couch game-night but wait for a patch for online to get better.

30627357.review:
Invisigun heroes is by far one of my favorite.

 Below I will give you reasons why you would want to buy this game and why you wouldn't. I just want to say before I do and before we delve into the facts that subjectively this is my favorite game and I implore you to at least try it. The [b]free demo version is a great place to start hop on the invisigun discord[/b] https://discord.gg/KJ88HV and test it out for yourself because unless you are stressed for time that is one of the best ways to truly see if this holy grail of a game is for you. Anyway on with the main review.

Visablity 

What is the first complaint I always see? Visibility. This game is a hard at first movement is a little tricky it will take getting used too 20-30min in and you will probably have a feel for it though and its just up from there. This is a key feature of the game and adds so much depth it is ridiculous. Ears become your new main sensory organ here. You can't just take away sight for people and tell them to go nuts. That just wouldn't work. This game adds huge audio clues and having fun at this gsme in the later stages is centric around understanding this simple sound step system. Headphones are certainly reccomended for this game it does include stereoscopic sound for steps. This is very very important for understanding where others and even yourself are located. This is easy to learn but hard to master which adds a great and fun curve to climb even at the highest levels of play people don't always know where someone is because of a thing called "vertical juking" where you pretend to go up and then go down and the such because you can't hear the difference in audio for the Y axis it can throw the person off and force them into a situation of uncertainty.

Characters-

Ability- each character has a unique ability that is centric for gaining an upper hand on your opponent. The characters ability is simple and doesn't hold enough influence to force you into a play style every character has a pretty flexible range of play styles and each character caters to some form of play style So you have options most characters abilitys are easy to understand but vary in complexity. Overall every character besides maybe Epi are very intuitive even early on where a game or two with them and you get the jist of what you can do.
Victory and dominance assertion/comedy- As of version 1.5 each character has a unique victory stance that you/and your friends can laugh at. With 8 characters 9 confirmed characters and possibly even more options are pretty varried. 

Planets- There are five planets (possibly another at some point definitely more maps though)  12 maps for each planet to a total of 60 maps.

Planet:mechanics- each  planet has a unique theme and unique mechanics for it. To avoid making this too lengthy I'll talk about one of my favorite planet and its mechanics. Arenae has a desert theme. Sand piles slowly gather in certain spots that slow down shots as they pass through to a minimum speed.  Walking through sand piles or shooting them removes them till they collect enough sand to be interacted with again. Sand tiles leave footprints when walked over and make a very unique sound. Carpets simply make a unique sound when walked on. Triggered walls are walls that either go down or up dependant on their current position when you step on the or one of many buttons located on the map. Rays of light can appear on the outskirts of maps that if walked near are blocked out thus revealing your position. Water makes a unique sound and visual when walked over but it doesn't leave any lasting marks like sand.

Game modes- these are already brushed up on if you simply look at the games description. They are all pretty neat but survival is surely the classic pick that represents the game very well.

Player base- being a single developer indie game has kept this game out of the light for too long. My original review had a complaint with finding matchs but I no longer have that problem on the discord. Randomly searching for matchs I haven't tried in a while but is starting to look promising the way we have been growing recently. I implore and highly recommend you join the discord. We are all a very polite and relaxed group of people who are almost always down to play. [b] again the link to the discord [/b] https://discord.gg/KJ88HV

Early adopting- I don't mean to sound like a hipcat but joining the discord and adding in what you think and adding constructive cool/creative ideas is always welcome and can actually change the game quite a bit. Not that many people do it so id you share your ideas you might see not only a better game but a game you can say you helped make.

Replay ability- this game has great replay ability because of online and how every match is going to be unique and constantly changing there is also a bot mode and a challenge mode that you can run through which is fun but plsying against a player is always more exiting. No worry about toxic behaviour either we try to keep that at an all time low in our discord as well as canned messages while playing the match they have been designed to be pretty lacking in BM potential.

More?-If you have any questions I haven't answered here or just want more direct and in-depth personal feedback please do not even hesitate to comment.

30181015.review:
Invisigun Heroes is a game I bought after watching the gameplay trailer one time.  Much like Crypt of the Necrodancer, I could tell this concept would be very fun to me, and I was not wrong.  But I think the concept of this game would be fun to *everyone* if they would just give it a chance.  This is the most fun game I've played in a long time.

First off, at its core this is a multiplayer competitive game like classic Bombermans or any arena fighter/shooter.  If you only like single-player games and have no friends: then Invisigun probably isn't for you.  You don't need to read anymore.  If however, you love laughing (and crying) with your friends through hilarious sets long into the night: you're almost doing yourself a disservice by not owning this game.

Gameplay:  The best.  The concept is easy to explain and the movement is snappy and grid-based.  Everyone is invisible, even you, but you can count steps and keep track of where you are without revealing yourself.  Shooting, using your chosen character's ability, bumping into anything accidentally, or walking through certain environments, all reveal you briefly.  There's a strong element of deception and prediction to the game.  I'll shoot a few times in a row walking forward along the bottom hallway of a map, then immediately stop and go back around a different way.  My antsy opponent will shoot down where I made him think I'd be, giving away his position.  And a few seconds later I shoot him from an angle he totally did not expect.  There are 8 characters and 50 maps right now, with 7 modes playable on every map and a lot of fun powerups.  The game is planning on having even more stuff added though.  It also supports local and online matches in any combination.  You can have only one friend over and game together on your PC and still take that lobby online to get 2 randos.  The netcode is surprisingly good for an indie game and the distances I play it at.  I have playable matches with people halfway around the world, which is more than I can say for Street Fighter V.  The only real potential flaw with the gameplay is that some stubborn players who refuse to think will just not get it.  You have to put in just a bit of effort to really enjoy this game and get decent at it.  People who won't even do that tend to (wrongly) dismiss the game as "all luck"

Graphics:  Solid.  This has some of the best tile art and effects I've seen in a game at this resolution, no pixel out of place.  Unfortunately the character sprites themselves in-game are the weakest part of the art, but they also spend most of the game being invisible.  By contrast, their full size art on the hero profiles and character select screens looks great.  Overall it's easily some of the bext pixel art around and quite a bit more stylized and less lazy than the endless storm of lazy games on steam cashing in on the words "pixel art" with no effort to prey on nostalgia.  In Invisigun, clearly deliniated tiles are important to the gameplay.  And these maps would make most SNES and GBA classics jealous.

Sound:  Great.  Every planet has two music themes and they are all really great, bass-heavy and jammin.  The main menu theme is alright but the loop is a little short, which can get repetitive if you are waiting on it for a while.  SFX are top notch and designed very well, with positional sound based on where the invisible enemy players are and different foot steps for every type of terrain.You'll want to turn the SFX above the music and any voice chat you're using, and also wear headphones.  A combination of subtle audio and visual cues are how you will figure out the positions of your opponents by their small mistakes.  The game supports turning the music all the way off if you'd rather play your own, but you're missing out if you haven't heard all of the planet themes yet.

In summary, Invisigun Heroes is actually fun in a way that I haven't enjoyed in a while.  It's rewarding in a way that games used to be with my friends when I was growing up, with the right combination of skill and luck that everyone had fun without being too far on the luck side to be watered-down garbage like Mario Kart.  I'm not spilling over with rage when I lose in Invisigun Heroes, which is a very different feeling than many other games in my Steam library; a much better feeling.  Right now the game is still in its early days and the community is very small, but it's also friendly and not a wretched hive of scum and toxicity like your MOBA of choice.  So not only is the game fun and non-threatening, but so are the players.  I only wish the community was a bit bigger, but it'll get there.  Maybe you can help it get there?

_______________________________________________________________________
I got this game on the recommendation of total bisquit.
Total bisquit says that this game is amazing and with depth but it has several big issues in my opinion.

I would like to state that the developer has addressed that they're working on some of the issues, and when they're fixed I will gladly pick up the game again and leave a positive review, but for now I can't recomend this game.

I made a review before and the developper themselves replied that my review was misleading because of one of the cons I stated. It made me doubt my initial judgement, so I picked the game back up to see if I was wrong and to record my experience/issue so there's no doubt what I'm talking about.

Pros:
Pretty pixel art
Nice music 
Many stages
Solid netcode

Cons:
The multiplayer/"matchmaking" system is garbage, instead of having 1 "matchmaking" button where it just finds the closest people who is also searching for games it has an old outdated "Host" and "join" system, where you either have to host or join to find a game. meaning for example, 2 people could be wantint to play the game, go to the join section for 5 minutes, with no luck and then both go to host, even though there are two people wanting to play they don't get to play because of the way the game is set up. This is by far the biggest issue with this game, combined with the small playerbase a game like this will naturally have, and the absurdly high pricetag you have a stillborn game. Movement IS NOT 1:1, but you have to time your presses, this causes the game to be unnesesarily unpredictable in my oppinion. The developper commented on my last review that this is untrue and misleading. I doubted myself and picked the game back up and took a video of the issue, now noone can really claim that it's misleading. seasoned players will naturally pick the timing up and will probably not even make individual key presses most of the time, but it is an unnesesarily frustrating aspect of the game especieally for a new player.

IH ist ein Spiel mit Fokus auf Mehrspieler-Matches (lokal und online, mit oder ohne Bots) mit bis zu 4 Leuten gleichzeitig.
Die Kämpfe selbst finden auf einer von derzeit 50 Maps statt, die sehr an alte Bomberman-Teile (z.B. auf dem SNES) erinnern.

Zur Wahl stehen, neben 7 Spielmodi, 8 spielbare Charaktere mit unterschiedlichen Fähigkeiten (z.B. Portale legen und benutzen, eine Drone losschicken oder Gegner mit einem Schwerthieb betäuben), die aber alle eines gemeinsam haben:
Sie sind während des Matches unsichtbar, solang sie nicht angreifen oder eine Fähigkeit benutzen.

Das bedeutet, dass während des Großteils einer Partie weder man selbst noch die Gegner zu sehen sind, was das Ganze zu einer unter Umständen sehr hinterhältigen Geschichte werden lässt, sobald man raushat, wie die eigenen Bewegungen einzuschätzen sind und man sich so auch ohne die eigene Figur zu sehen orten kann.
In dem Moment verbringt man mehr Zeit damit, die Gegner zu beobachten und mögliche Wege zu finden, diese um die Ecke zu bringen, zu verwirren, ihnen Hinterhalte zu stellen usw.

Das mag in Schriftform seltsam klingen - vor allem wenn die Schriftform meine ist - aber es kann einen Heidenspaß machen.

ALLERDINGS ist die Playerbase des Spiels noch sehr klein - und das ist die Krux an der Geschichte - sodass es aktuell schwierig sein kann, regelmäßig Online-Matches zu finden, wenn man nicht den offiziellen Discord-Channel zur Hilfe nehmen will. 
Letzterer ist voller netter Leute (noch) und hilft beim Starten von Spielen ungemein - rudimentäre Englischkenntnisse, neben Discord als Programm, sollten aber vorhanden sein um da was in Gang zu bringen.

Alles in allem meine vollste Empfehlung. 
Macht unheimlich viel Spaß!

- - -

Ach ja, einen unspektakulären Singleplayer gibt es auch. Nur um es erwähnt zu haben.

29974626.review:
This game is absolutely stunning and original. The concept of playing as an invisible character leads to a lot of interesting strategies, and keeping track of myself is a challenge that I've never experienced in a game before. The wide variety of modes, maps, and playable characters, not to mention bots and the single player challenge mode, add enough content to fully warrant the $15 price tag. I particularly like how many stage gimmicks there are that really change the game around. My favorite so far has to be the lightning which briefly reveals all players. The sound and art are also amazing. In particular, the visual distortion effects are superb.

My only real negative is the lack of an online player base. It's difficult to find matches, and there usually aren't any at a given time. You can host your own matches, and it doesn’t take too terribly long to find somebody, but waiting for a third and fourth person would probably take a while. I think that if the menu was cleared up to prominently feature a "Host Public Match" button right next to the "Join Public Match" button, or if a player matchmaking queue was implemented, this problem could probably be mitigated to some extent. I don't entirely buy that the lack of online activity is due to lack of player interest. Also, there's always the public discord server for finding matches if you want to go the extra mile, but that is in no way a permanent solution. Hopefully this problem can be resolved, because this is certainly a spectacular game.

29918181.review:
We bought it as it was touted as "A mix of towerfall and bomberman" ...sadly its neither of these things.

We played it 4 player local multiplayer, for about an hour. It's frustrating, boring, and when people do get killed/you win it's ultimately anticlimactic.

Art style is nice, ui is nice, audio is good, engine runs well, but the core "hook" of the game just isn't that great - and that's the most crucial part.

It's definitely not worth £10.99, so I refunded it. If it was £1.99, it might have been worth keeping for the occasional knock about, but for the time being: stick with Towerfall or Bomberman, don't bother with Invisigun Heroes.

Shame really, thought this was going to be a good one.

This game absolutely rekindles the kind of excitement one expects when playing [insert-your-favorite-single-screen-multiplayer-game-here] with a handful of buddies. The thrill of getting inside your opponents' heads to outwit them is strong in this one. The controls are really simple, and the game is super easy to learn and understand (even with plenty of characters and maps to learn), but becoming GOOD at it is definitely a challenge. Multiple characters all with their own abilities add flavor and style, and from what I've been hearing possibly another character in the future. Get this while it's hot, and stick around so the player base doesn't take a flip. Game has a lot to offer, and will definitely keep me playing for a hot minute. Has a few bugs but the devs are still working on it, and from what I've seen they're not big enough to complain about. Only thing I can ask for, is tournaments and a 2v2 option. Go invisible, snipe your friends in the back, and GET THIS GAME so you can do so. OH! and you can put in your own custom phrases for the characters to say at the end of each round, just because.

29910958.review:
[b] Данную игру я рекомендую для людей,  готовых к открытому общению и желающих поработать своими мозгами. Так же я НЕ советую её тем, кто остерегается или избегает иностранных людей по различным причинам и тем, кто уже свыкся с онлайн играми крупных разработчиков, у которых нажав кнопку "Найти игру" программа все делает за вас. Ниже я объясню причины того, почему данная игра не придется по вкусу всем или даже большинству. [/b]

Вы играете против 1-3 игроков за персонажа, который является невидимым. Невидимость раскрывается на пару секунд если вы стреляли или использовали свою уникальную способность, которая для каждого персонажа своя. Ваша задача не потеряться в ориентации в пространстве, т.к. вы не видете как себя, так и противников; следить за подсказками, которая дает игра о вашем нахождении и нахождении других игроков (звуки шагов, шевеление кустов, на снегу появляются отпечатки, стены, в которые врезаются игроки, подсвечиваются); не ошибиться самому  и не выдать свое местоположение, потому что одна ошибка может стоить вам жизни. [b] В этой игре если вы словите хоть один выстрел - вы умерли [/b]; за каждого персонажа каждый игрок может выработать свою тактику игры: кто-то играет агрессивно, кто-то играет в защиту, кто-то играет в контроль карты. Все зависит от вас, вашей изобретательности, способности быстро мыслить и предугадывать действия противников. 
Все это сопровождается приятной музыкой и пиксельной графикой, а так же живым общением с людьми по интересам, а иногда и с разработчиками, и обсуждением впечатлений на общем сервере в дискорде.


Сражу скажу о двух недостатках:
[olist]
[*] Поиск игроков нужно проводить общаясь с людьми напрямую. В игре не имеется автоподбора игроков и кто-то должен выступить в роли Хоста, а другие люди к нему подключаются.
[*] Второй недостаток вытекает из первого и он заключается в пинге. Если у хоста не очень хороший провайдер и между вами имеется расстояние больше, чем между соседними улицами, то пинг все-таки отражается на игровом процессе.
[/olist]

Эти недостатки значительно скажутся на количестве желающих в первое время, пока число игроков не возрастет достаточно, чтобы у создателей игры имелся смысл держать сервера с автоподбором игроков.  Одна из причин этому - англоязычное сообщество. Не все владеют английским языком на достаточном уровне по различным причинам (либо же сами не верят в то, что нормально знают), и языковой барьер становится проблемой - чтобы собрать людей вам с ними необходимо поговорить лично и многие желают так же разговаривать с вами в процессе игры.

Но в свою очередь это становится своего рода одним из плюсов данной игре, о которых я сейчас расскажу.

[olist]
[*] Из личного опыта, люди, собирающиеся на парочку матчей, достаточно лояльны друг к другу, образованны и с ними приятно общаться во время матчей. Если вам с кем-то понравилось играть, то вы можете сыграть с ним в любое другое время, легко найдя его вновь на сервере дискорда.
[*] Желающие подтянуть свой разговорный язык могут это сделать в данной игре, т.к. все с пониманием относятся к вам и ничего от вас не требуют. Общение происходит на доступном уровне и организовывается своего рода товарищество.
[*] По самой игре, приятная музыка и графика.
[*] Игровой процесс, который не требует от вас огромного количества времени. Все матчи проходят довольно быстро, до 20-30 минут при четверых игроках и до 10 минут 1на1.
[*] Сбалансированная и честная игра. Все персонажи доступны вам сразу, их не надо открывать и все по своему уникальны. 
[*] Огромное количество карт с различными препятствиями, погодными условиями, бонусами, которые влияют на ход игры и каждый раунд не похож на предыдущий.
[*] Несколько игровых режимов.
[*] Последнее, но не менее важное - удовольствие, которое получаешь от игры. Не зависимо от того, обыграл ты противника, или он тебя - игра не напрягает и всегда можно посмеяться с глупых ошибок.
[*] Этот пункт еще не в силе, но общаясь с разработчиками я узнал, что скоро будут введены стимовские карточки и разработчики уже занимаются этим вопросом. Так  же в процессе создание новых героев.
[/olist]


На этом и заключается обзор данной игры. Если вам все же захочется дать шанс этой игре и опробовать ее, милости просим. Наше сообщество всегда радо новым игрокам и готовы помочь в освоении игрового процесса. 
Надеюсь, что мой обзор был для вас полезен.

29909052.review:
Invisigun Heroesとは！
ステルスとシューティングを組み合わせた全く新しい対戦シューティンｇ…いやこれだとそーでもないな。
いやしかし、このゲームのステルスっぷりはただ事ではありません。なんとみんな完全透明になってしまうのです…そう、自分が操作するキャラすらも！

[h1]見逃すな　その足跡が　命取り[/h1]
さて、先に述べた通り、敵も自機もゲーム開始時点で透明になります。
じゃあどうやって自機の位置を確認したり索敵するのかと申しますと、こんな感じ。
[list]
[*]足音
ざっくりとですが相手の位置を掴めます。
[*]地形の変化
砂地や水場を歩くと波紋や足跡が出現します。また不可視中でも光は遮られるため、日照のある窓に近付くと陰ったりします。
[*]壁との接触
壁などの移動阻害地形に触れるとその壁にエフェクトが発生します。
[*]他プレイヤーとの接触
他のプレイヤーと触れると双方一瞬不可視が切れ、更に少しの間行動不能になります。
[*]攻撃
ショットを撃つ際に一瞬不可視が切れます。
[*]特殊能力の使用
各キャラ固有の特殊能力を使う際に不可視が切れます。
[*]一部対戦ルールのシステム
一部の対戦ルールでは、勝利条件を満たそうとすると不可視が切れたり、あるいは非常に現在位置が判り易くなります。
[/list]
そのほか移動速度は一定なので、記憶力と操作精度さえ完璧ならば、自機の位置は常に特定可能です（※かなり難しい）。
さて、彼我の位置関係がはっきりしたらショットを撃ちましょう。一発当てれば相手は容赦なく白骨化し死亡！　逆に当てられたら自分がスケルトン！　大変判り易い命のやり取りに震えが止まりません。

[h1]さあ選べ　マップにルール　キャラクター[/h1]
このゲームには7つの対戦ルールと8人のキャラクター、そして滅法沢山の対戦マップが存在します。

他プレイヤーを全滅させて既定のラウンド数を先取するSurvival、特定の領域に一定時間とどまるZone Controlといった判り易いものから、マップ全域にランダムに現れる魔物の近くに留まり、地中に返すことで出現するコインを集めるBeast Tamer、某スプラなんとかのように地面を自分のカラーで染め（ただし染める方法はタイル上を歩くことのみ）、ゲーム終了時に最大面積を塗ったプレイヤーが勝利するLand Grabといった捻りの利いたルールもあり、更にマップは矢鱈滅多に数があるため、毎回同じ展開というのはなかなか起きにくくなっています。

また8人のキャラクターはそれぞれ特殊能力を持っており、ジャンプして地形や弾を飛び越える、当てた相手を短時間行動不能にできる上に弾を跳ね返す斬撃を出す、一定軌道を往復し、他プレイヤーを見つけると追従して爆発するビットを放つなどなかなか多彩。
マップによって若干の有利不利は生じますが（ダッシュ移動ができるキャラは入り組んだマップだと若干能力を生かしにくいなど）、基本的には大きな差は出にくく実力勝負になりやすい構成です。

そうそう、ゲームモードは2種類のみです。
ひとつはマルチプレイヤーモード。オンラインオフライン人間BOT入り乱れて、様々なルールでの対戦が楽しめます。メインコンテンツはこちら…なんですが、プレイヤー数があまり多くなく、なかなかマッチングしません。
とはいえ、少人数ながらちょこちょこと遊んでいる方はいるので、皆さんも是非購入してプレイしてほしいなあ。ていうか、キックスターターでそこそこ沢山投資があったはずなのに、何故こんなにプレイヤーが少ないのか…。

もうひとつはチャレンジモードで、こちらはソロ専用。ゲーム中に登場する全ステージをEasy、Normal、Hardの3レベル分、Botプレイヤー3体を相手に1ラウンドも落とさずに4ラウンド先取する必要があるというなかなか面倒くさいモードです。

[h1]gif動画　いつでも作成　できるのよ[/h1]
さて、このゲームは各ラウンド終了時にボタン一発で決着前後数秒分のリプレイをgif動画として出力することができます。
ほらほらこんな感じ↓
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=860718693
これで思わず笑っちゃうような対戦結果や俺TUEEEEE動画を撮影してアップロードしたら楽しいと思わない？　思うよね！
はい、じゃあそんなあなたはサクッとInvisigun Heroes買って遊びましょう。
いやホント、こんな良くできたゲームなのになんでこんなに人少ないんだろうね。やっぱりキャラが透明で絵面が地味だからかなあ。

29863588.review:
Backed this game during it's Kickstarter, suffice it to say the final product is a fantastic game.

It's effectively Bomberman, but instead of dropping bombs everyone uses an Invisigun, which fires a blast in a direction that goes until it hits an object or a player. Everyone is invisible but firing your gun or using your character's signature ability causes you to become temporarily visible. In addition environments are designed with small features that give away your location (walking in water causes splashes, snow leaves foot prints, windows casting light will have the light obscured if your standing in the way, etc.). Game is playable locally with up to 4 players. The AI is very smart-but fair. Gameplay is addicting, and I highly recommend it to anyone who enjoys co op games in a similar fashion to Bomberman or Towerfall.

29848791.review:
Invisigun - what an absolutely glorious indie gem!  If you read no further, go with your instinct and give this title a chance at the asking price – it’d be *criminal* to pass this one by.  An amazing distillation of so many classic favourites from over the decades, combined with unique and highly clever mechanics, Invisigun has sunk its hooks into me from the first moment, and I can't wait to experience more.  Think Bomberman with beautiful classic Zelda-inspired graphics, hints of Power Stone, and frissons of several other “greats”.  And don’t even get me started on the soundtrack!  Only a few hours in, I’m already awestruck by the love and polish evident in every aspect, the simple-to-learn-but-hard-to-master gameplay, and the genuine and immediately-apparent FUN.  I don’t say this lightly – I see genuine brilliance evident in this game and give mad respect to its one-man developer.  

Taking the narrow view, it's a great "party game" – but it doesn’t take much effort to reveal oh-so-much more under the surface.  There's real strategy and skill involved, to be developed over a long period of practice and experience.  Yes, it’s easy to jump into, but even in my first online multiplayer matches with evenly-matched opponents, I was finding myself embroiled in satisfying sparring matches of bluffs, jukes, and mindgames to anticipate the location of the competitors and bait them into my traps whilst avoiding the same in return.  This is a case of satisfying my inner-competitive-strategist, but in digestible periods of time which work well with a busy lifestyle – a typical first-to-5-wins match often takes only five to ten minutes!  Speaking of longevity, there are already 50 unique maps at launch, with deformable and otherwise-dynamic terrain, each of which favours unique strategy and caters to the skills of different characters.  But I’m told there are already more maps on the way, and even another character!

I’m clearly all in favour of Invisigun but, as with any game at launch, there are a few issues that could be improved.  And those mostly involve the online matchmaking.  While it can be fun to learn maps by sparring with the bots in offline singleplayer, this game is undoubtedly at its best in live multiplayer.  And there *are* people playing online! - but you wouldn’t necessarily know it unless you jump onto the Discord channel.  You see, there is no online server browser – you can only choose which region (or “all”/”best” regions) you wish to connect to, then search for an open match to jump into.  But unless a host is actually sat in their created lobby, waiting for players to join, then you won’t know the server even exists because you cannot join matches in progress, even to sit in the lobby.  And if a multiplayer match is partially filled out with bots (optional), then those bots fill the available slots for human players to join.  So for all practical purposes right now, you’ve got to jump onto the Discord channel and do your matchmaking there.  However, the developer seems to be very aware of these issues and I have faith that they will be addressed in due course.  On the other hand, my early interaction with the player community through Discord has been an entirely positive experience!

To me, this game is a real treasure find – the kind I sift through endless product release pages and games bundles hoping to discover.  I had no idea it even existed before launch, and it arrived without any hype on Steam.  Were it not for a casual glance at the “new releases” list for the day and a few minutes with a Twitch stream by LEMental,  it might have passed me by entirely.  What an unjust fate that such an expertly crafted and outstanding title be left unnoticed by the masses due to underexposure.  Well! - hopefully those of us lucky enough to find it, and sing its praises, bring more of our fellow gamers into the fold!  One only needs to know it it exists and to try it, then the quality of the game speaks for itself.  So grab it, then come find us on Discord! https://discord.gg/ycEhg2Q

29825419.review:
玩了大概一小时单机，先简单评价一下。

[h1]游戏模式[/h1]
游戏是一个FFA(free for all)的竞技场模式，使用最简单的射击和一个根据选择角色的而不同的技能，尽可能的击杀别人活到最后。
这款游戏的亮点在于，[b]不论是敌人还是自己，都是隐形的。[/b]这里的隐形，是连玩家自己控制的角色都看不到的，只有开枪和放技能的一瞬间会显形，这就极大的增强了本身很简单的竞技场的模式的乐趣。由于大家谁都看不见谁，而且挨一枪就会死，但是又需要开枪找自己的位置，所以游戏整体节奏会非常紧张刺激，[spoiler]有点“忍村”的感觉[/spoiler]

[h1]可玩性[/h1]
即使再新奇的竞技场模式，没有新玩意儿也是很容易腻的。游戏内置了非常多的地图，有很多地图的地形、环境对于游戏玩法是有很大改变的。比如水踩上去会有水花，墙壁上的灯会被挡住亮光，下雨打雷的一瞬间可以看到所有人等等等等..对于本身贫乏的游戏模式增添了不少亮点。
[spoiler]不过单机再丰富，这种游戏模式一个人玩也是太孤独了（	不建议单人玩家入手，或者等降价也可以。[/spoiler]

[h1]画面/音乐[/h1]
画面绝对是像素游戏的佼佼者！光影、环境、打击感都非常棒，如果喜欢像素风格应该不会不喜欢这款游戏。
音乐就是规规矩矩的“像素风格”了，风格很统一，不过有点单调。对于音乐不是很在行，就不多评论了。

推荐度
对于单机玩家6/10
虽然有在线匹配功能但是因为人少实际上是找不到人的
有基友一起玩的话8/10
支持本地4人，不过真在一个键盘上4个人玩估计要死人。少两分是友尽分。其实有朋友一起玩的话，什么游戏不能打10分呢

On point pixel art, great game mechanics, quality sound design; this game needs an army of players right now! 
Well worth the price of admission if you're a fan of classics like Bomberman or newer titles like Towerfall. Or if you have even a passing interest in gaming. Buy it; it costs less than most things and is better than a lot of them. Take pizza for example... Pizza is highly overrated as a party expense. Just fire this up at your next party! Your guests will forget about minor concerns like hunger, thirst or the declining economic and social climate, and soon they will have transcended to a level of pure ninja-like precision. Living only to strike, deadly from the shadows. Like a snake. Or a tiger or something. I don't know. I'm rambling now, aren't I? I always do this, I have trouble knowing when to stop. Should I stop now? I'll stop.

29803002.review: Kickstarter backer here. I've been playing this game since alpha.  It's a nice twist on the single screen arena genre.  Since both you and your opponents are invisible most of the time, it demands some effort to track your own position as you play, but the payoff when this becomes second nature is worth it. It's simple to grasp but has a high skill ceiling, and has become a lunchtime favourite on the office couch. The pixel graphics are a perfect homage to 16 bit 90s consoles with lush palettes, the maps are varied and full of detail and interesting features, and the sound design is deep and multilayered.

29791489.review:
I first played Invisigun at PAX, and I loved it. I immediately went home and backed it on kickstarter so I could get it as soon as possible. I followed it intensely, and had a month where I was checking my email and the forums multiple times every day just so I could get even a scrap of news about it. As soon as I got it, I promptly annoyed my friends incessantly to play with me. Sadly, I ended up playing mostly with bots. :Neko: That was fine, though. Even with the three worlds that there were when I got it, there was still a ton to do. The game only went uphill from there. Much to my delight, the bots AI was improved immensely until they actually became as good as a real player. Two new planets were added, full of new mechanics. New heroes were added, and the gameplay was completely changed based on the discussions on the forums. This game kept getting better and better, and it won't stop now. The dev is one of the best I've seen, and sure knows how to make a great game. Honestly, this game coudld go down in history as one of the first and THE best to pull off "everyone is invisible." (A surprising amount of companies have started developing games shockingly similar to this. I think they can see how successful this game will be! :P) Without a doubt, I highly recommend this game.

I look forward to seeing you join us; we need some more people to play online with! :D

Note: on most of my games, I leave my computer running for weeks, so the hours are greatly exaggerated. This is not the case with Invisigun. Me and my friends have actually played almost 162 hours and I'm not tired of it yet! It looks like I never play this game, but don't be fooled. It's one of my all-time favorites.

29790121.review:
This game is definitely worth a look for anybody that likes competitive party-style games!  

Take the 4-player single-screen chaos of Bomberman, add invisibility, stealth tactics, class-based abilities, tons of maps, lots of game modes, and now you're starting to get the picture.  Relatively easy to pick up, but has a high skill ceiling if you really get into it.

Unlike a lot of indie competitive games, it has support for bots AND multiplayer AND shared screen playing.  All in the same match, if you want!  And then there are single player challenges on top of that.  So no worries about buying a game that you can't play when nobody else is at your house!

There is also great music and awesome pixel art with tons of little details in the active environments that give other players away (footsteps, water splashes, moving cameras, opening doors, etc)...just tons of love and polish in every aspect!  And it all impacts the gameplay.

Disclaimer: I am a friend of the developer, and he is one of the nicest and most genuine guys you could ever meet, so my opinion may be biased.  I'm OK with that.  :)

29786509.review:
Invisigun Heroes adds depth to the classic 'Bomberman' shared screen party game formula with the addition of invisibility for all players and special character abilities.  The game achieves complexity and depth without sacrificing ‘pickup and play’ simplicity.

Players can select from several characters each with their own special ability, then vary their gameplay with diverse strategies from deviously sneaky to fiercely aggressive while keeping opponents guessing due to the invisibility mechanic.

The game is not a run of the mill low-resolution game, every map is overflowing with lovingly created pixel art, from rain drops splashing onto the ground to particle effects floating in the air.  It seems there is always something new to notice.

Invisigun Heroes is remarkably flexible, allowing players to mix and match local players with online players and enjoy many modes across a vast selection of unique and engaging maps.
While the game is best playing against friends, the single player Survival Challenge mode is a great way to try maps, characters and refine your skills while invisible.

It is truly a pleasure to play. Even on a losing streak, a tricky play that surprises your opponent and leads to a kill will leave a smile on your face.  Moments like these will keep you playing for hours.

I [b]highly[/b] recommend Invisigun Heroes.

29786448.review:
​This game is AMAZING! A very interesting take on the 4 player top down party style game. A must have for anyone who likes games such as Towerfall or Samurai Gunn. But, this game blows those games out of the water with it's extra features (online multiplayer) and novel mechanics.

Basics: Everyone is invisible. You can move on a grid orthogonality (up, down, left, right). Each step makes a noise. When you fire or use an ability (8 different characters) it reveals you for a short time. If you bump into or walk over certain terrain it can give away your location subtly via sounds or animation cues.

Graphics: If you like the pixelated art style, they NAILED IT!

Music: The diverse scores capture the feel of the different planets (5). I could listen to most of them on repeat.

Sound Effects: Sound is SO IMPORTANT in this game and they did a fantastic job at conveying things like footsteps to the players. I highly recommend headphones. I feel that people with hearing impairments will struggle with this game but it's not unplayable.

Multiplayer: Multiplayer is the core of this game. Invisigun Heroes allows you to play cross platform (Linux, Mac, Windows) multiplayer with anyone in the world. You can also add more local players seemlessly. There is basic matchmaking and you can even host private ip games. There is no online communication (you will want to join the discord).

Controls: Keyboard can be remapped to be any controls. This game is meant for controller though. My Xbox360 controller and iBuffalo classic USB gamepad worked like a charm. This game can be a little tricky to get your berrings on where you're at. I can see new players being frustrated by that learning curve.

Gamemodes: There are 7 different gamemodes of everything you might want in a game like this, all of which are free for all (no teams (っ- ‸ – ς) ).

TLDR Pros/Cons:

Pros: Cross platform local/online multiplayer (up to 4 playes/bots), fantastic pixel art, great retro inspired music, 50 stages, 7 gamemodes, easy to understand, high skill cap.

Cons: Free for all only (no teams), no real singleplayer game (bots only), learning curve to move while invisible, no online chat.​

39488217.review:
This game is a blast. The unique premise is executed very well and makes for an addictive game you can quickly pick up and play for a round, or sink hours into at a time.

What really suprised me is the amount of content in the game. There are 67 maps across 6 different planets that have different layouts, aesthetics and gimmicks, 9 characters with different powerups, 7 unique game modes and a suprisingly fun and relaxing single player mode that should take you 5-10 hours (depending on the difficulty a lot).

The only issues I have with the game is that going from round to round can take a bit longer than I'd like (though it's definitely not egregious), occasional crashes with intel graphics (the game is lightweight and ideal for laptops) and there aren't enough people playing it!

The game is well designed, well executed, polished and definitely worth the price, so go buy it and contribute to the player pool!

It's rare to see a game with an unique concept. It's even more rare to see the game pull it off successfully. Invisigun Heroes does just that. It's weird to get the hang of, but it's so satisfying and fun once you get used to it. On top of the solid concept there's also 8 different characters with unique abilities as well as a variety of powerups.

All in all it's simply fun. There's also a free demo: even if you're skeptical there's no good excuse not to give this game a try! You'll have to bring some friends though, the playerbase is not great to say the least (there is a Discord you can poke around in for games as well).
